trans-unit.source: Use MapReduce and PowerShell with Hadoop | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use MapReduce and PowerShell with Hadoop | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use PowerShell to remotely run MapReduce jobs with Hadoop on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use PowerShell to remotely run MapReduce jobs with Hadoop on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: This document provides an example of using Azure PowerShell to run a MapReduce job in a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This document provides an example of using Azure PowerShell to run a MapReduce job in a Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: An Azure HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster (Windows-based or Linux-based)
trans-unit.target: An Azure HDInsight (Hadoop on HDInsight) cluster (Windows-based or Linux-based)

trans-unit.source: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: A workstation with Azure PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Install and Configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Install and Configure Azure PowerShell</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Azure PowerShell provides cmdlets that allow you to remotely run MapReduce jobs on HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Azure PowerShell provides cmdlets that allow you to remotely run MapReduce jobs on HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: Internally, this is accomplished by using REST calls to <linkText>WebHCat</linkText><title></title> (formerly called Templeton) running on the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Internally, this is accomplished by using REST calls to <linkText>WebHCat</linkText><title></title> (formerly called Templeton) running on the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: The following cmdlets are used when running MapReduce jobs in a remote HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following cmdlets are used when running MapReduce jobs in a remote HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Add-AzureAccount: Authenticates Azure PowerShell to your Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Add-AzureAccount: Authenticates Azure PowerShell to your Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: New-AzureHDInsightMapReduceJobDefinition: Creates a new job definition by using the specified MapReduce information
trans-unit.target: New-AzureHDInsightMapReduceJobDefinition: Creates a new job definition by using the specified MapReduce information

trans-unit.source: Start-AzureHDInsightJob: Sends the job definition to HDInsight, starts the job, and returns a job object that can be used to check the status of the job
trans-unit.target: Start-AzureHDInsightJob: Sends the job definition to HDInsight, starts the job, and returns a job object that can be used to check the status of the job

trans-unit.source: Wait-AzureHDInsightJob: Uses the job object to check the status of the job.
trans-unit.target: Wait-AzureHDInsightJob: Uses the job object to check the status of the job.

trans-unit.source: It waits until the job completes or the wait time is exceeded.
trans-unit.target: It waits until the job completes or the wait time is exceeded.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureHDInsightJobOutput: Used to retrieve the output of the job
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureHDInsightJobOutput: Used to retrieve the output of the job

trans-unit.source: The following steps demonstrate how to use these cmdlets to run a job in your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The following steps demonstrate how to use these cmdlets to run a job in your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Using an editor, save the following code as mapreducejob.ps1.
trans-unit.target: Using an editor, save the following code as mapreducejob.ps1.

trans-unit.source: You must replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: You must replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: Open a new Azure PowerShell command prompt.
trans-unit.target: Open a new Azure PowerShell command prompt.

trans-unit.source: Change directories to the location of the mapreducejob.ps1 file, then use the following command to run the script:
trans-unit.target: Change directories to the location of the mapreducejob.ps1 file, then use the following command to run the script:

trans-unit.source: When the job completes, you should receive output similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: When the job completes, you should receive output similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: This output indicates that the job completed successfully.
trans-unit.target: This output indicates that the job completed successfully.

trans-unit.source: If the ExitCode is a value other than 0, see Troubleshooting.
trans-unit.target: If the ExitCode is a value other than 0, see Troubleshooting.

trans-unit.source: The MapReduce job stored the results of the operation to Azure Blob storage, in the wasb:///example/data/WordCountOutput path that was specified as an argument for the job.
trans-unit.target: The MapReduce job stored the results of the operation to Azure Blob storage, in the wasb:///example/data/WordCountOutput path that was specified as an argument for the job.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blob storage is accessible through Azure PowerShell, but you must know the storage account name, key, and the container that is used by your HDInsight cluster to directly access the files.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blob storage is accessible through Azure PowerShell, but you must know the storage account name, key, and the container that is used by your HDInsight cluster to directly access the files.

trans-unit.source: Fortunately, you can obtain this information by using the following Azure PowerShell cmdlets:
trans-unit.target: Fortunately, you can obtain this information by using the following Azure PowerShell cmdlets:

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureHDInsightCluster: Returns information about an HDInsight cluster, including any storage accounts associated with it.
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureHDInsightCluster: Returns information about an HDInsight cluster, including any storage accounts associated with it.

trans-unit.source: There will always be a default storage account associated with a cluster.
trans-unit.target: There will always be a default storage account associated with a cluster.

trans-unit.source: New-AzureStorageContext: Given the storage account name and key retrieved using Get-AzureHDInsightCluster, returns a context object that can be used to access the storage account.
trans-unit.target: New-AzureStorageContext: Given the storage account name and key retrieved using Get-AzureHDInsightCluster, returns a context object that can be used to access the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureStorageBlob: Given a context object and container name, returns a list of blobs within the container.
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureStorageBlob: Given a context object and container name, returns a list of blobs within the container.

trans-unit.source: Get-AzureStorageBlobContent: Given a context object, a file path and name, and a container name (returned from Get-AzureHDinsightCluster), downloads a file from Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: Get-AzureStorageBlobContent: Given a context object, a file path and name, and a container name (returned from Get-AzureHDinsightCluster), downloads a file from Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: The following example retrieves the storage information, then downloads the output from wasb:///example/data/WordCountOutput.
trans-unit.target: The following example retrieves the storage information, then downloads the output from wasb:///example/data/WordCountOutput.

trans-unit.source: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Replace CLUSTERNAME with the name of your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: This example will store the downloaded files to the example/data/WordCountOutput folder in the directory that you run the script from.
trans-unit.target: This example will store the downloaded files to the example/data/WordCountOutput folder in the directory that you run the script from.

trans-unit.source: The output of the MapReduce job is stored in files with the name part-r-#####.
trans-unit.target: The output of the MapReduce job is stored in files with the name part-r-#####.

trans-unit.source: Open the example/data/WordCountOutput/part-r-00000 file in a text editor to see the words and counts produced by the job.
trans-unit.target: Open the example/data/WordCountOutput/part-r-00000 file in a text editor to see the words and counts produced by the job.

trans-unit.source: The output files of a MapReduce job are immutable.
trans-unit.target: The output files of a MapReduce job are immutable.

trans-unit.source: So if you rerun this sample, you need to change the name of the output file.
trans-unit.target: So if you rerun this sample, you need to change the name of the output file.

trans-unit.source: If no information is returned when the job completes, an error may have occurred during processing.
trans-unit.target: If no information is returned when the job completes, an error may have occurred during processing.

trans-unit.source: To view error information for this job, add the following command to the end of the mapreducejob.ps1 file, save it, and then run it again.
trans-unit.target: To view error information for this job, add the following command to the end of the mapreducejob.ps1 file, save it, and then run it again.

trans-unit.source: This returns the information that was written to STDERR on the server when you ran the job, and it may help determine why the job is failing.
trans-unit.target: This returns the information that was written to STDERR on the server when you ran the job, and it may help determine why the job is failing.

trans-unit.source: As you can see, Azure PowerShell provides an easy way to run MapReduce jobs on an HDInsight cluster, monitor the job status, and retrieve the output.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, Azure PowerShell provides an easy way to run MapReduce jobs on an HDInsight cluster, monitor the job status, and retrieve the output.

trans-unit.target: For general information about MapReduce jobs in HDInsight:
